synopsis: Vote to pass a bill that prohibits municipal governments from passing ordinances and regulations relating to single-use plastic straws.
name: HB 771 - Prohibits Municipal Governments from Prohibiting Plastic Straws - Florida Key Vote
pg: Highlights: Requires counties and municipalities to address the contamination of recyclable material in contracts for the collection, transportation, and processing of residential recyclable material, with the following considerations (Sec. 1): A residential recycling collector is not required to collect or transport contaminated recyclable material; A recovered materials processing facility is not required to process contaminated recyclable material; and Each contract regarding residential recycling collection or transportation, and each request for proposal or other solicitation for the collection of residential recyclable material, must define the term “contaminated recyclable material”. Prohibits a county, a municipality, or other local government entity from adopting or enforcing an ordinance or local regulation regarding single-use plastic straws, until July 1, 2024 (Sec. 3). Requires the Office of Program Policy Analysis and Government Accountability to conduct a study of each ordinance or regulation restricting or prohibiting the use of single-use plastic straws (Sec. 3).
